intro: Echinocystis oregana, commonly known as the Oregon horsegram, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant produces distinctive yellow flowers and spiny, spherical fruits that contain edible seeds. It is often found in dry, disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential agricultural use.
